div.head: Preamble
div.p: Here are thirty very legal propositions. The propositions, summarily and succinctly, touch on various things related to the rights that the Church and Christian princes have, or can have, over infidels of any kind.

The propositions principally show the true and most strong legal basis for the supreme title and lordship over the world called the West Indies, which the monarchs of Castilla and León rightly have. Therefore, they constitute universal emperors in this world over many kings.

The propositions also note other things concerning what has happened in this world, which are highly remarkable and worthy of being seen and heard. Bartolomé de las Casas or Casaus, who was Bishop of the Royal City of Chiapa in New Spain, collated the thirty propositions. Year 1552.
